title: Park Monitor
description:
The Job

Boundless Adventures is an outdoor aerial adventure park, which is an obstacle course in the trees. Climbers get harnessed up and go on a self-guided adventure, with staff present on the ground for assistance and encouragement. We have nine courses at four levels of difficulty with courses that are between ten and forty feet in the air. The obstacles range from simple bridges to difficult hanging platforms that climbers must jump across. This is a rain or shine facility, closing only for thunderstorms and/or more extreme weather. Our Spring and Fall season are weekend admission only, with the possibility for larger group bookings on the weekdays. We are open full time, seven days a week in the Summer. We open to the public in April and close for the season around Thanksgiving. We use five point harnesses and the CLiC-iT safety system to keep our climbers safe.

The Role

As a park monitor, your role is to ensure the safety and well-being of the guests. This position is not unlike being a lifeguard, with a few key differences. For one, you are just as much a coach as a cop. Many of our guests may have never done something like this before; you need to be on the lookout for people who need help or encouragement, as well as those who are breaking the rules.

Guests are also able to tap out any time, and do not have to continue on a course should they become too tired or afraid. When that happens, your job is to climb up to them and get them down quickly and safely. Additionally, you must be able to speak publicly. Part of the process of getting people up and into the trees is the safety briefing. Before we allow our climbers on to the course, each must attend a safety briefing where a monitor demonstrates how to use the safety equipment and conveys all of the rules to the climbers.

Qualities

Prospective applicants should have the following qualities and/or the desire to improve or acquire these qualities through their work.

● Open-Mindedness

● Comfort in nature

● Comfort at heights

● A reasonable degree of fitness

● Communication skills

● Public speaking skills

● At least ten hours a week they’re willing to work

● A strong work ethic

Climbing and Belay experience is a plus.

This is an entry level position. The company is prepared to teach prospective employees all necessary skills to perform the monitor role.

Compensation

Pay starts at 15 dollars an hour. Training is paid for. Higher levels of proficiency and training earn a higher rate.

Scheduling

We offer flexible scheduling. During the spring and fall, out hours depend on group bookings and school schedules. Prospective staff should be willing to work nights, weekends, and holidays. We offer flexible scheduling, with shifts ranging from 4-9 hours. Prospective staff should be aware that staff with more open availability will most likely receive more hours. Being available for spring, summer and fall is a big plus.

Training and Duties

We have 3 levels of certification for our monitor position. The 1st level, M1, are staff who are trained to harness and brief guests, monitor the main platform and Junior Explorer Courses, and guide guests. The second level, M2, have all the same responsibilities as an M1, but are also trained in rescue techniques, so they can lower guests off the course if the need arises. M3s, our most senior monitors, are asked to help lead, teach, and help maintain the courses. Both our M2 and M3 levels receive compensation commensurate with their duties.

M1 trainings is about 16 hours, M2 training is an additional 16 hours. M3 is awarded based on performance and experience.

**Serious applicants should apply via our website at https://boundlessadventures.net/ny-park/were-hiring/**

* Assesses collaborates and documents patient/family’s basic learning needs to provide initial and ongoing education to patients and family.

title: Code Blue Coordinator
description:
**Code Blue Coordinator Position**

**Job Description**

* Position Title: Code Blue Coordinator
* Congregation: Trinity Church, Asbury Park, New Jersey
* Job Type: Part-time position; Fixed-Term (Approximately September - May)
* Time Commitment: 15-25 hours per week; Some Nights and Weekends
* Proposed Compensation Package: $25 per hour. Eligible for cost-of-living adjustments.

Trinity Church is a Monmouth County Code Blue Warming Center. Monmouth County calls a Code Blue emergency when temperatures drop below 32 degrees. When this happens, Trinity Church believes housing is a human right and opens its gym up from 7pm-6:30am to anyone in the county that needs a warm space to stay. We provide warmth, safety, and hospitality to a diverse group of individuals who are unable to shelter themselves elsewhere. Trinity Church is seeking a Code Blue Coordinator to manage our program throughout the winter months. The Coordinator will train, supervise, and schedule Intake Specialists, Safety Facilitators, and volunteers to staff our Warming Center during Code Blue and weather emergencies, manage space needs and supplies, and ensure a safe, welcoming, caring environment for all.

**Essential Duties and Responsibilities:**

* Work closely with Trinity Church administration in the coordination, development, and administration of the Code Blue Program
* Cultivate volunteers from around Monmouth County and maintain database of the same with identification of time preferences and availability
* Train staff and volunteers to understand expectations of job performance, code of conduct, safety, and security
* Ensure shifts are covered at all times with adequate staff and volunteers
* Supervise staff and volunteers of Code Blue and ensure policies and procedures are followed at all times
* Coordinate with the City of Asbury Park, Monmouth County Social Services, and other local organizations to have social workers and case managers attend Code Blue nights to provide resources and long-term solutions for our community members experiencing homelessness.
* Ensure Code Blue space is set-up and kept neat and clean before, during and after usage nights by utilizing a combination of volunteers and staff
* Track, maintain, and organize program supplies
* Recruit and coordinate local restaurants and volunteers to provide food and beverages for Code Blue participants
* Develop, maintain, and monitor proper paperwork, signage, and policies
* Track and report on statistics and demographics of the Code Blue program and participants to gain a better understanding of who uses our services and how we can better meet their needs
* Assist the Trinity Center for Community Development Manager in identifying new funding sources and maintain relationships with current donors.
* Develop relationships and coordinate with outside organizations to provide services to Code Blue participants
* Work to increase program visibility and awareness in the community
* Participate in regular team and supervisory meetings
* Perform other related duties as required.

**Preferred Qualifications & Requirements:**

* Administrative experience in programs which involved either recruitment, selection, training, and development of employees or volunteers or experience in social services, community organizing, and/or community services.
* Caring, compassionate, energetic, self-starting and exceedingly well-organized individual with demonstrated expertise in communications and excellent interpersonal skills.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
* Experience in the field of community services and community coordinating work
* Computer skills: Word, Excel, File Maker Pro or similar database program
* Experience working in a non-profit or community service environment
* Demonstrated ability to provide high quality service within constrained resources in a multi-user environment.
* Proven leadership ability and experience coordinating, facilitating, teaching and coaching individuals and teams in successful service endeavors
* Spanish language skills are a plus

**Skills & Abilities:**

* Knowledge of theory, practices and procedures of modern volunteer coordinator administration
* Ability to speak effectively before community groups and communicate effectively to a diversified population
* Ability to instruct, direct and evaluate volunteers
* Ability to understand the dynamics of racism, gender identity, sexual orientation, poverty and economic injustice
* Ability to assess volunteer and staff development and training needs and ensure training is implemented
* Ability to maintain records, reports, files
* Comfort in working for a progressive faith-based organization that celebrates LGBTQ+ people.
* Strong problem-solving and conflict resolution skills.
* Position requires the successful completion of a background check. Trinity employees are expected to respect diversity and promote equity and inclusion for all people.

**Hours**
